thread.title: Greens call for capital gains tax change
thread.title_full: Greens call for capital gains tax change

title: Greens call for capital gains tax change
text:
View Photo 

The Australian Greens say removing the discount on capital gains tax would generate as much as $74 billion in revenue over the next decade. 
"Income earned in wages is fully taxed, income earned from sale of assets like property or shares is 50 per cent tax free. What is the justification for this?" deputy Greens leader Scott Ludlam asked. 
Releasing Parliamentary Budget Office costings on Wednesday, Senator Ludlam said along with his party's earlier proposals to reform negative gearing, it would raise $127 billion over 10 years. @y7finance on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook Greens call for capital gains tax change AAP
